item.title: Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
Cindi add a quote by Tammara Webber
item.description: "I belong to you. There is no one else. All I want is to be where you are." -- Tammara Webber

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
item.description: "Are you any good at it?" "Pulling idiots out of the snow? I'm the best." -- Cynthia Hand

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
Cindi add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "Don't cry because it's over, smile because it happened." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Jeri Smith-Ready
Cindi add a quote by Jeri Smith-Ready
Cindi add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "I wouldn't want to marry anybody who was wicked, but I think I'd like it if he could be wicked and wouldn't." -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Sarah Dessen
item.description: "I am coming to terms with the fact that loving someone requires a leap of faith, and that a soft landing is never guaranteed." -- Sarah Dessen

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "Sometimes you make choices in life and sometimes choices make you." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "I realize now that dying is easy. Living is hard." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "If you stay, I'll do whatever you want. I'll quit the band, go with you to New York. But if you need me to go away, I'll do that, too. I was talking to Liz and she said maybe coming back to your old life would be too painful, that maybe it'd be easier for you to erase us. And that would suck, but I'd do it. I can lose you like that if I don't lose you today. I'll let you go. If you stay." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "You don’t share me. You own me." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "I needed to hate someone and you’re the one I love the most, so it fell on you." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Gayle Forman
item.description: "But I'd do it again. I know that now. I'd make that promise a thousand times over and lose her a thousand times over to have heard her play last night or to see her in the morning sunlight. Or even without that. Just to know that she's somewhere out there. Alive." -- Gayle Forman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "When falsehood can look so like the truth, who can assure themselves of certain happiness?" -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Mary Shelley
item.description: "Thus strangely are our souls constructed, and by slight ligaments are we bound to prosperity and ruin." -- Mary Shelley

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "You pierce my soul. I am half agony, half hope...I have loved none but you." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
item.description: "This is isn't going to become one of those creepy situations where you show up at all hours of the night to watch me sleep, is it?" he asks playfully." -- Cynthia Hand

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Myra McEntire
item.description:
"I walked in without knocking. The screen door banged to a close behind me announcing my presence. I followed my nose to the kitchen and found Kaleb standing by the stove. He stirred something that smelled absolutely delicious a wooden spoon in one hand and a huge chef’s knife in the other.
“Are you sober ” I asked from the doorway.
He turned and leveled a smile at me that made me a little wobbly. “I am."
“Good. Because if not I was going to take the deadly kitchen utensil away from you.” I crossed the room and pulled myself up to sit on the counter beside the stove. A cutting board full of green peppers and two uncut stalks of celery waited for attention from the knife. Melted butter and diced onions bubbled in a sauté pan on the stove. “You cook"
Kaleb was so pretty I was jealous. Pretty with ripped muscles and a tattoo of a red dragon covering most of his upper body. “Yes ” he said. “I cook.”
“Do you usually wear a wife beater and ” I pushed him back a little by his shoulder “an apron that says ‘Kiss the Cook’ while you’re doing it ”
He leaned so close to me my heart skipped a couple of beats. “I’ll wear it all the time if you’ll consider it." -- Myra McEntire

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Myra McEntire
item.description: "I'm a bad ass. A bad ass who bakes when he's depressed." -- Myra McEntire

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Myra McEntire
item.description: "That hurts me in my feminism." -- Myra McEntire

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Tammara Webber
item.description: "Brooke?” I puff out a sigh. “For chrissake, Reid, who do you think it is? And haven’t you put me into your contacts yet?” “Yeah... It just says Satan, though, and I forgot I’d assigned that title to you." -- Tammara Webber

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Tammara Webber
item.description: "When you tell me to be good, it makes me want to be good,' I say, hearing the undisguised desire in my voice. I run my fingers through the hair at her temples, taking her face between my palms, and she doesn't move. 'It also makes me want to be very, very bad." -- Tammara Webber

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Rachel Vincent
item.description: "Chocolate says "I'm sorry" so much better than words." -- Rachel Vincent

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Wendy Higgins
item.description: "Good gracious, he was sexy—a word that had not existed in my personal vocabulary until that moment. This guy was sexy like it was his job or something." -- Wendy Higgins

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When writing a novel, that's pretty much entirely what life turns into: 'House burned down. Car stolen. Cat exploded. Did 1500 easy words, so all in all it was a pretty good day." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Cindi add a quote by Cynthia Hand
item.description: "What do you see in a guy like Christian Prescott?" he asked me that night when he dropped me off from prom. And what he was really saying then, what would have come through loud and clear if I hadn't been so blind was, <i>why don't you see me?</i>" -- Cynthia Hand
